TopicTitle: Video Wednesday: HOCgaming returns to playing KSP

Articles.Content: HOCgaming is back playing KSP. For those of you not familiar with HOC, heÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s made severral notable KSP series such as ThatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s No Mun Base and his Artificial Gravity exploits, that grew his channel to a follower count of over 100,000 people. He has also hosted two charity events around a KSP mission, raising tens of thousands of dollars for [https://www.charitywater.org/](**Charity: Water**. All in all one can safely say that Harvey is a true mastodon in the KSP community, and weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re very happy to see him playing the game after a six month break. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve followed him in the past or if youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not following him yet then we can definitely recommend his channel.
Quoting what I said from the PS4 announcement, '*I never saw that one coming!'*Ã¢â‚¬â€¹

After what he did to his channel with "The last project" and quitting KSP in the first place I don't think i'll be watching him again for a while.

It would still be cool if he did another charity project though.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T19:47:16Z" title="06/19/2015 07:47  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Jon144**
My, what an awful presenter. Worst vid I've seen in a long time.

> 
> All in all one can safely say that Harvey is a true mastodon in the KSP community,

So why are you showcasing him?

The Last Project was a burnout project. What did he expect? If anyone is looking for a good KSP series idea, simply start reviewing and showcasing popular craft published by users on kerbalx.com. Call it "This Week on Spacecraft Exhange" or something.

Harv is back. Yay!

I hope he does another thing for charity.

> 
> The Last Project was a burnout project. What did he expect? If anyone is looking for a good KSP series idea, simply start reviewing and showcasing popular craft published by users on kerbalx.com. Call it "This Week on Spacecraft Exchange" or something.

^That's actually a nice idea. I don't think people give much attention to video Wednesdays (compare the amount of replies with Devnote Tuesdays), a "This Week on Spacecraft Exchange" would be cool.
